articles.title: About the project
articles.contents:
The project is inspired by the Pedallers Arms cooperative project supported by Latch.
In each session there will be two people who have experience of fixing bikes to help with minor repairs such as punctures, gear servicing and replacing brake pads.
We cannot fix major repairs but we can provide advice and help diagnose problems.
The focus is on helping you to fix your own bike and giving you the skills to fix your bike, and help others, in the future.
Get in touch with any questions or if you’d like to help by donating parts, tools or volunteer time by emailing us at sundayservicels7@gmail.com.
If you would like to fix your bike you can book it in by filling in our booking form here.
We ask that you fill in the form before bringing your bike although anyone is more than welcome to pass by to say hi while we’re working on bikes.

articles.title: Bike Fix Sunday LS7
articles.description: The Bike Fix Sunday community bike repair and servicing project based in the LS7 area, Chapeltown, Leeds
articles.contents:
Find us at the Coach House towards the end of Back Newton Grove.
It’s just off Chapeltown Road and next to Potternewton park, where we open 2pm - 5pm on Sundays, currently the last Sunday of the month.

The map below shows we’re within walking distance of lots of streets in the LS7 postcode.





See our opening times in the Calendar below.


We help you fix your bike and build your bike servicing skills so you can fix it next time it needs a basic repair and share the knowledge.
You need to fill in a short form telling us what you would like to fix on your bike and what time you plan to arrive.
To book your bike in for the next Sunday that we’re open, please fill in the form here: https://forms.gle/WVeLv2QKKkoByDpi8
For further info see our about page and our Facebook page to ask questions and help build the bike fixing community in LS7: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1422757118107420
